CatDescriptText: Mr. John C. Beal, merchant, 2153 Centre Ave., Mr. Walter Green, barber, 2150 Centre Ave., and Mr. Charles Cypress, 2164 Centre Ave., was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 31, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Who is your ward chairman? Does he have any power?  Does he exert it?" Mr. John C. Beal's answer reads: "Robert E. Williams is ward chairman and he's doing a very favorable job looking out for the welfare of the people of the ward.  He is cooperative in every respect and exerts his power."  Mr. Walter Green's answer reads: "My ward chairman is Dave Thompkins and he is doing a good political job in securing employment.  He has power and exerts it."  Mr. Charles Cypress' answer reads: "The ward chairman- Well, mine is none other than Pappy Williams.  And he's all right."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of John C. Beal, Walter Green, and Charles Cypress, standing next to Lucky Cafe Chop Suey restaurant, Centre Avenue, Hill District
